00024 
00025 #ifndef VMIVIEW_H_
00026 #define VMIVIEW_H_
00027 
00028 // VMI area includes
00029 #include "vmi/vmiCommand.h"
00030 #include "vmi/simAddrTypes.h"
00031 #include "vmi/vmiTypes.h"
00032 #include "vmi/vmiTyperefs.h"
00033 
00034 
00036 // VIEW USER INTERFACE
00038 
00039 //
00040 // Install a callback to be invoked each time a view object is created or deleted
00041 //
00042 void vmiviewAddViewObjectNotificationCallback(
00043     vmiViewObjectNotifyFn   notifyCB,
00044     void                   *userData
00045 );
00046 
00047 //
00048 // Remove callback which is invoked each time a view object is created or deleted
00049 //
00050 void vmiviewRemoveViewObjectNotificationCallback(
00051     vmiViewObjectNotifyFn   notifyCB,
00052     void                   *userData
00053 );
00054 
00055 //
00056 // Install a callback to be invoked each time a view event is created or deleted
00057 //
00058 void vmiviewAddViewEventNotificationCallback(
00059     vmiViewEventNotifyFn    notifyCB,
00060     void                   *userData
00061 );
00062 
00063 //
00064 // Remove callback which is invoked each time a view event is created or deleted
00065 //
00066 void vmiviewRemoveViewEventNotificationCallback(
00067     vmiViewEventNotifyFn    notifyCB,
00068     void                   *userData
00069 );
00070 
00071 //
00072 // Install a callback to be invoked each time a particular view event occurs
00073 //
00074 void vmiviewAddViewEventListener(
00075     vmiViewEventP           event,
00076     vmiViewEventListenerFn  listenerCB,
00077     void                   *userData
00078 );
00079 
00080 //
00081 // Remove callback which is invoked each time a particular view event occurs
00082 //
00083 void vmiviewRemoveViewEventListener(
00084     vmiViewEventP           event,
00085     vmiViewEventListenerFn  listenerCB,
00086     void                   *userData
00087 );
00088 
00089 //
00090 // Return a view object's name (e.g. "registerA")
00091 //
00092 const char *vmiviewGetViewObjectName(vmiViewObjectP object);
00093 
00094 //
00095 // Return a view object's description string (or NULL if none available)
00096 //
00097 const char *vmiviewGetViewObjectDescription(vmiViewObjectP object);
00098 
00099 //
00100 // Return a view object's full path (e.g. "/platform/peripheral0/registerA")
00101 //
00102 const char *vmiviewGetViewObjectPath(vmiViewObjectP object);
00103 
00104 //
00105 // Return a view object's value
00106 //
00107 // The caller passes in a buffer and the buffer size in bytes.
00108 // If the buffer is large enough the value is written to the buffer and the value type
00109 // is returned, otherwise VMI_VVT_NOSPACE is returned and bufferSize is updated with
00110 // the size required. VMI_VVT_ERROR is returned if no value is available for an object.
00111 //
00112 vmiViewValueType vmiviewGetViewObjectValue(
00113     vmiViewObjectP          object,
00114     void                   *buffer,
00115     Uns32                  *bufferSize
00116 );
00117 
00118 //
00119 // Return a view object's value as a string
00120 //
00121 // The caller passes in a buffer and the buffer size in bytes.
00122 // If the buffer is large enough the value string is written to the buffer and a pointer to the string
00123 // is returned, otherwise NULL is returned and bufferSize is updated with the size required.
00124 // NULL is returned with bufferSize of zero if no value is available for an object.
00125 //
00126 const char *vmiviewGetViewObjectValueString(
00127     vmiViewObjectP          object,
00128     void                   *buffer,
00129     Uns32                  *bufferSize
00130 );
00131 
00132 //
00133 // Return a view object's parent object
00134 //
00135 vmiViewObjectP vmiviewGetViewObjectParent(vmiViewObjectP object);
00136 
00137 //
00138 // Return a view object's child object
00139 //
00140 vmiViewObjectP vmiviewGetViewObjectChild(vmiViewObjectP object);
00141 
00142 //
00143 // Return a view object's sibling object
00144 //
00145 vmiViewObjectP vmiviewGetViewObjectSibling(vmiViewObjectP object);
00146 
00147 //
00148 // Return a view event's name (e.g. "read")
00149 //
00150 const char *vmiviewGetViewEventName(vmiViewEventP event);
00151 
00152 //
00153 // Return a view event's description string (or NULL if none available)
00154 //
00155 const char *vmiviewGetViewEventDescription(vmiViewEventP event);
00156 
00157 //
00158 // Return a view event's full path (e.g. "/platform/peripheral0/registerA/read")
00159 //
00160 const char *vmiviewGetViewEventPath(vmiViewEventP event);
00161 
00162 //
00163 // Return a view event's parent object
00164 //
00165 vmiViewObjectP vmiviewGetViewEventParent(vmiViewEventP event);
00166 
00167 #endif /* VMIVIEW_H_ */
